statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Santa Clara 51, Sacramento St. 32
article.story: SANTA CLARA, Calif. -- John Bryant scored 14 points and grabbed 15 rebounds to lead Santa Clara past Sacramento State 51-32 on Saturday night. Bryant recorded the 30th double-double of his career and sixth of the season as Santa Clara (4-4) won its third consecutive game. He also blocked six shots. Loren Leath led Sacramento State (1-6) with 10 points. No other Hornet scored in double-figures. Kevin Foster added 13 points for the Broncos on 5 of 12 shooting. He made 2 of 3 from 3-point range. James Rahon scored 8 points. The 6-foot-11, 275-pound Bryant nearly had a double-double in the first half when he scored eight points, pulled down eight rebounds and blocked three shots, helping Santa Clara build a 27-14 lead. Santa Clara, with the towering Bryant defending inside, held Sacramento State to 22.7 percent shooting in the first half and 25.0 percent for the game. The 32 points were the fewest Santa Clara has allowed since beating Loyola Marymount 58-35 last season on Jan. 19, 2008. Santa Clara quickly extended its lead in the second half. Foster hit a bank shot then drilled a 3-pointer, giving Santa Clara a 34-16 lead with 16:24 left. Later in the half, Foster nailed another 3-point shot, pushing Santa Clara's lead to 42-22 with 10:17 left to play. Santa Clara remained undefeated in the series, winning for the sixth straight time. Early in the second half, Santa Clara starting guard Troy Alexander landed hard on his left shoulder as he and Sacramento State's Leath battled for a loose ball. Alexander, a freshman, went to the locker room, in obvious pain. Alexander suffered a shoulder sprain. He was taken to a hospital for X-rays.
